column1: BBC News NI outlines the latest data on coronavirus and vaccinations across Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland.Northern Ireland recorded one further Covid-related death on Thursday
column2: bringing the total number of deaths to 2
column3: 154.The death occurred outside the past 24 hours.The latest figures show that 80 more people have tested positive for coronavirus. It means that a total of 122
column4: 895 people in Northern Ireland have had a confirmed diagnosis since the pandemic began.There are 17 people being treated for the virus in hospital
column5: one in intensive care.Last updated 3 June at 14:15 BSTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandA total of 1
column7: 173 vaccines have been delivered so far in Northern Ireland.Of those
column12: 398 are second doses.Last updated 3 June at 14:15 BSTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandNo further Covid-19-related deaths were reported in the Republic of Ireland on Thursday
column13: with the country's death toll remaining at 4
column14: 941.The Irish Department of Health said 465 new cases of Covid-19 had been recorded.The department also said there were 84 people with Covid-19 being treated in hospitals around the country.Thirty of those in hospital are being treated in ICUs.Last updated 3 June at 17:27 BSTSource: Department of Health Ireland/World Health OrganisationBut as of 23 May
column15: the WHO says that a total of 2
column17: 207 vaccines doses were administered in the Republic.Last updated 2 June at 14:45 BST
